Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#168; Item 5.07&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. Broadcom Inc. (&#8220;Broadcom&#8221;) held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on April 21, 2025 (the &#8220;2025 Annual Meeting&#8221;). At the 2025 Annual Meeting, Broadcom stockholders voted on the following matters and cast their votes as set forth below: (1) The nine nominees were elected to serve as directors of Broadcom until the next annual meeting of stockholders or until their successors have been elected: Name For Against Abstain Broker Non-Votes Diane M. Bryant 3,639,441,896 24,472,502 4,239,647 437,172,957 Gayla J. Delly 3,636,182,471 25,742,825 6,228,749 437,172,957 Kenneth Y. Hao 3,652,775,806 11,057,603 4,320,636 437,172,957 Eddy W. Hartenstein 3,610,591,597 53,111,357 4,451,091 437,172,957 Check Kian Low 3,621,477,655 40,359,204 6,317,186 437,172,957 Justine F. Page 3,651,952,245 11,950,192 4,251,608 437,172,957 Henry Samueli, Ph.D. 3,590,033,324 74,069,045 4,051,676 437,172,957 Hock E. Tan 3,652,399,652 11,863,809 3,890,584 437,172,957 Harry L. You 3,326,645,289 337,162,605 4,346,151 437,172,957 (2) A proposal to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm of Broadcom for the fiscal year ending November 2, 2025 was approved: For Against Abstain Broker Non-Votes 4,040,418,924 61,661,153 3,246,925 0 (3) An advisory vote to approve the named executive officer compensation was approved: For Against Abstain Broker Non-Votes 3,387,380,526 274,703,048 6,070,471 437,172,957 SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized.
